faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Answers to the questions we get asked most often

items.question: How much do your services cost?
items.answer: Cost depends on project complexity. A small Telegram bot starts from 3,000 CHF, website from 8,000 CHF, complex platform from 30,000 CHF. We provide exact estimate after discussing requirements. First consultation is free.

items.question: How long does development take?
items.answer: MVP is usually ready in 4-8 weeks. Full product — 2-4 months. Complex enterprise solutions — 6-12 months. We work Agile with weekly demos, so you see progress at every stage.

items.question: Do you work with clients outside Switzerland?
items.answer: Yes, 40% of our clients are from other countries: Germany, Austria, CIS countries. We work remotely, communicate in Russian, English and German. CET timezone is convenient for Europe.

items.question: What if I don't like the project?
items.answer: We work on a milestone model: you pay for stages as they are completed and approved. If something is wrong at any stage — we redo it at our expense until full approval.

items.question: Do you provide support after launch?
items.answer: Yes, lifetime support is included in every project. This is not marketing — we really answer questions and help with minor improvements. For major changes we discuss separately.

items.question: Can I start with a small project?
items.answer: Of course. Many clients start with MVP or pilot project to evaluate work quality. 80% of them return with larger tasks.

items.question: How do you ensure data security?
items.answer: We work according to ISO 27001 and OWASP standards. All projects undergo security review. If necessary, we involve certified partners for penetration testing. GDPR and Swiss DPA compliant.

items.question: What does technical documentation include?
items.answer: Full package: architecture documentation, API reference, developer guides, deployment and maintenance instructions. Your team will be able to maintain the system independently.
